title: UNESCO
summary: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)[1] (French: Organisation des Nations unies pour l'Ã©ducation, la science et la culture) is a specialised agency of the United Nations (UN) aimed at promoting world peace and security through international cooperation in education, the arts, the sciences, and culture.[2][3] It has 193 member states and 11 associate members,[4] as well as partners in the non-governmental, intergovernmental, and private sector.[5] Headquartered at the World Heritage Centre in Paris, France, UNESCO has 53 regional field offices[6] and 199 national commissions[7] that facilitate its global mandate.
